# ResourceImporter

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

**Inherited By:** [EditorImportPlugin](class_editorimportplugin.md), [ResourceImporterAnimatedTexture](class_resourceimporteranimatedtexture.md), [ResourceImporterBitMap](class_resourceimporterbitmap.md), [ResourceImporterBMFont](class_resourceimporterbmfont.md), [ResourceImporterCSVTranslation](class_resourceimportercsvtranslation.md), [ResourceImporterDynamicFont](class_resourceimporterdynamicfont.md), [ResourceImporterImage](class_resourceimporterimage.md), [ResourceImporterImageFont](class_resourceimporterimagefont.md), [ResourceImporterImageFrames](class_resourceimporterimageframes.md), [ResourceImporterLayeredTexture](class_resourceimporterlayeredtexture.md), [ResourceImporterMP3](class_resourceimportermp3.md), [ResourceImporterOBJ](class_resourceimporterobj.md), [ResourceImporterOggVorbis](class_resourceimporteroggvorbis.md), [ResourceImporterScene](class_resourceimporterscene.md), [ResourceImporterShaderFile](class_resourceimportershaderfile.md), [ResourceImporterSpriteFrames](class_resourceimporterspriteframes.md), [ResourceImporterSVG](class_resourceimportersvg.md), [ResourceImporterTexture](class_resourceimportertexture.md), [ResourceImporterTextureAtlas](class_resourceimportertextureatlas.md), [ResourceImporterWAV](class_resourceimporterwav.md)

Base class for resource importers.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

This is the base class for Redot's resource importers. To implement your own resource importers using editor plugins, see [EditorImportPlugin](class_editorimportplugin.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Import plugins](../tutorials/plugins/editor/import_plugins.md)

## Enumerations

enum **ImportOrder**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_ResourceImporter_ImportOrder)

<a id="class_ResourceImporter_constant_IMPORT_ORDER_DEFAULT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ImportOrder](class_resourceimporter.md#enum_ResourceImporter_ImportOrder) **IMPORT_ORDER_DEFAULT** = `0`

The default import order.<a id="class_ResourceImporter_constant_IMPORT_ORDER_SCENE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ImportOrder](class_resourceimporter.md#enum_ResourceImporter_ImportOrder) **IMPORT_ORDER_SCENE** = `100`

The import order for scenes, which ensures scenes are imported *after* all other core resources such as textures. Custom importers should generally have an import order lower than ``100`` to avoid issues when importing scenes that rely on custom resources.<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_ResourceImporter_private_method__get_build_dependencies"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedStringArray](class_packedstringarray.md) **_get_build_dependencies**\ (\ path\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceImporter_private_method__get_build_dependencies)

Called when the engine compilation profile editor wants to check what build options an imported resource needs. For example, [ResourceImporterDynamicFont](class_resourceimporterdynamicfont.md) has a property called [ResourceImporterDynamicFont.multichannel_signed_distance_field](class_resourceimporterdynamicfont.md#class_ResourceImporterDynamicFont_property_multichannel_signed_distance_field), that depends on the engine to be build with the "msdfgen" module. If that resource happened to be a custom one, it would be handled like this:

```
    func _get_build_dependencies(path):
        var resource = load(path)
        var dependencies = PackedStringArray()

        if resource.multichannel_signed_distance_field:
            dependencies.push_back("module_msdfgen_enabled")

        return dependencies
```
